turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hi How are you?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Hello, I am great, how are you?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I'm great as well! Have you by chance ever heard of an organization called Save the Children?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes I have heard of them.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Perfect! So then you are familiar that they are an outreach program that helps children not only from different countries but also in the U.S. get the help that they need?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes, they are a great help to all.  I am very impressed with them.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's so comforting to hear! Not many people are aware of the organization! They have many ways that we can help continue their mission. Are you familiar with any of those programs as well?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I only know about the feeding program.  I did not know they did other things

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, the feeding program is probably the most common and also one of the most successful.  However they do have other programs as well that helps keep them moving.  You can become a monthly donor, sponsor a child, shop the gift catalog from their website, or there's the Make a one-time gift program, which is what I'm here for!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: How much can they really do with a couple of bucks though?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: They can feed entire camps with several couple dollars! That's how they're funded! They get running water and electricity to children that need it.  Just a few bucks adds up when its coming from a couple of people, you know?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I guess so.  Seems they have many supporters, makes me feel like mine drop in the bucket is meaningless.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I don't think so at all. It makes you a contributor to a wonderful cause, not a drop in a bucket! If a few bucks was the difference between getting child(ren) out of a hostile living environment and into one more stable, wouldn't that mean something to you? That definitely could be the case. It's not meaningless. It's a valued contribution.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I would possibly donate at some point

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's great to hear and you have the perfect opportunity right now.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I want to be able to give more than $2.  I will consider giving in the future.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: You could give the $2 from chatting with me about this cause and donate again - by any one of those means that I mentioned above in any amount that you are satisfied with.  It's free money going to a good cause and it all gets taken care of directly from here.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I prefer to give directly through the website.  I am here to make money.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's so unfortunate. It's basically giving free money to children who have no essentially nothing and you're still getting paid whether you donate or not.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I understand where you are coming from, I just prefer to give on my own time.
